brainly_data.question:
Which of the following best describes the British position toward Native Americans after the Revolutionary War?
a. The British offered to take the Native Americans to the safety of other British territories.
b. The British insisted on protections for the Native Americans in the writing of the Treaty of Paris.
c. Native Americans were given supplies to ease a retreat to the west, away from the new nation.
d. The British abandoned their Native American allies and didn't give them protection in the Treaty of Paris.
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question:
Which of the following best describes the British position toward Native Americans after the Revolutionary War?
a. The British offered to take the Native Americans to the safety of other British territories.
b. The British insisted on protections for the Native Americans in the writing of the Treaty of Paris.
c. Native Americans were given supplies to ease a retreat to the west, away from the new nation.
d. The British abandoned their Native American allies and didn't give them protection in the Treaty of Paris.
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text: The best option regarding the British position toward Native Americans after the Revolutionary War would be that "d. The British abandoned their Native American allies and didn't give them protection in the Treaty of Paris," since the British only "used" them during the war.
